llm.feedback:
Up | Sep–Nov | Regime A easing path with front-end cuts (~50bp) and a 4.2%–4.3% 10-year yield corridor; dollar softer and risk assets rally on easing prospects | Watch for the actual September 50bp cut realization and CPI/jobs data confirming easing, and monitor the 4.2%–4.3% yield corridor and USD direction | 45% (GX057ADL7)(C22MKA9VY)
Up | 3–6 months | Faster/larger easing than base-case plus robust IPO momentum and WFE demand could push ACMR toward USD38–42 as a re-rating unfolds | Watch rate-cut pace surpassing ~150–175bp by year-end, continued WFE ramp (Ultra C wb/N2 bubbling) and IPO momentum (95 deals, USD12.9 billion YTD) | 25% (C22MKA9VY)(SK994CBWR)(Q7VVGNSQE)
Down | Sep–Nov | Bear path from policy frictions or geopolitics—AI hardware controls and regulator tensions tilt policy toward tightening; risk premia rise and Russell/SMID underperform | Watch escalation in export controls or geopolitical tensions, Russell/SMID weakness, and a weaker WFE demand outlook | 20% (H7Q52FKDH)(37UZC9X8I)(C22MKA9VY)(Q7VVGNSQE)
Down | 0–3 weeks | Inflation shocks or policy reversals trigger regime transition—higher yields, stronger USD, risk-off across assets | Watch for inflation surprises, Jackson Hole wage signals, or BOJ tone shifts that imply tighter policy or delayed easing, triggering risk-off | 20% (GX057ADL7)(YB758UDBU)(K0WFSW29E)
